text: The Back-to-Africa movement is a movement for African Americans and the black diaspora to move back to Africa. African repatriation for ex African slaves and free black people from North America and other Western societies began during the eighteenth century. https://www.cambridge.org/core/books/cambridge- guide-to-african-american-history/backtoafrica- movement/F16272CE27E9158A11A4AFB936FD8384 They founded the country of Liberia. ==References== Category:African-American history Category:History of Africa Category:Emigration
title: Back-to-Africa movement
